alert.note: Alert for Oglethorpe; Wilkes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 05 at 2:48PM EDT until April 05 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Georgia, east central Georgia, north central Georgia, northeast Georgia, southeast Georgia and west central Georgia, including the following counties, in central Georgia, Baldwin, Bibb, Bleckley, Crawford, Crisp, Dodge, Dooly, Houston, Jasper, Jones, Laurens, Monroe, Montgomery, Peach, Pulaski, Putnam, Telfair, Twiggs, Wheeler, Wilcox and Wilkinson. In east central Georgia, Emanuel, Glascock, Greene, Hancock, Jefferson, Johnson, Taliaferro, Treutlen, Warren, Washington and Wilkes. In north central Georgia, Morgan. In northeast Georgia, Oglethorpe. In southeast Georgia, Toombs. In west central Georgia, Chattahoochee, Harris, Lamar, Macon, Marion, Muscogee, Schley, Stewart, Sumter, Talbot, Taylor, Upson and Webster. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flash flooding in addition to flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Areas of rainfall will continue across the watch area through the rest of this evening, with isolated instances of flooding. A break in rain is expected later tonight, but additional development is expected tomorrow with added rainfall of one and a half to two and a half inches of rainfall is possible across the watch area, with some locally higher amounts up to three inches possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
